Package io.github.ai4ci.functions

Interface ResampledDistribution

All Superinterfaces:
Distribution, Serializable
@Immutable public interface ResampledDistribution extends Distribution, Serializable
A resampled distribution formed by combining samples from two distributions using a binary combiner function.

This interface defines a distribution that draws PRECISION samples by repeatedly sampling two component distributions and applying the configured ModelOperation.BiFunction combiner. It is useful when a derived distribution is constructed by combining two stochastic sources such as when modelling the sum, difference or other combination of two uncertain quantities.

Downstream uses: the resulting resampled data is consumed by empirical or interpolated distribution routines such as EmpiricalDistribution and by risk or behaviour modelling code that requires a sample-based representation. See also StateUtils for places where sampled distributions are used in state transformations.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • getCombiner

      ModelOperation.BiFunction<Double,Double,Double> getCombiner()
      The binary combiner applied to pairs of samples from the two component distributions.
      Returns:
      the combiner function

    • getCumulative

      default double getCumulative(double x)
      Empirical cumulative distribution function computed from the resampled values. The implementation counts values strictly less than x and applies the usual (rank + 1)/(N + 1) correction used for empirical CDFs.
      Parameters:
      x - threshold at which to evaluate the cumulative probability
      Returns:
      the empirical cumulative probability P(X < x)

    • getFirst

      Distribution getFirst()
      The first component distribution used to generate samples.
      Returns:
      the first distribution

    • getInterpolation

      @Lazy default EmpiricalDistribution getInterpolation()
      Returns an empirical interpolation of the resampled distribution.

      This builds an EmpiricalDistribution from the link function and the resampled values. The interpolation may be more efficient for repeated queries such as quantile lookups.

      Returns:
      an interpolated empirical distribution derived from the samples

    • getSamples

      @Derived default double[] getSamples()
      Generate PRECISION samples by repeatedly sampling the two component distributions and applying the combiner. This method performs sampling eagerly and may be moderately expensive; callers that require many repeated queries should use getInterpolation() to build an empirical distribution for more efficient lookups.
      Specified by:
      getSamples in interface Distribution
      Returns:
      an array of PRECISION sampled values from the resampled distribution

    • getSecond

      Distribution getSecond()
      The second component distribution used to generate samples.
      Returns:
      the second distribution

    • sample

      default double sample(Sampler rng)
      Draw a single sample by sampling the two components and applying the combiner. This is the basic sampling operation used to generate the full resampled array.
      Specified by:
      sample in interface Distribution
      Parameters:
      rng - the random sampler to use
      Returns:
      a single sampled value
